name: High Number of pods in Not Ready state.txt - Issue
description: This section explains that there is a high number of pods in an unavailable state, indicated by a 0/1 ratio, which means that none of the desired pods are running. This issue could be caused by spot instance termination or the Kyverno policy engine blocking the pod deployment. The section provides a link to a monitoring dashboard for the Kyverno usage in the EKS cluster.

name: High Number of pods in Not Ready state.txt - Debugging
description: This section explains that when there are fewer pods in a ready state, it can cause the application to malfunction or behave unexpectedly. This is because the application may not have enough resources or capacity to handle incoming requests or workloads, leading to errors or performance issues.
use_cases: Ensuring high availability and reliability of applications
Troubleshooting and debugging application issues related to pod readiness

name: High Number of pods in Not Ready state.txt - Resolution
description: This section provides guidance on troubleshooting and resolving issues related to a high number of pods in a 'Not Ready' state. It suggests first examining the pod/deployment logs to identify the root cause of the failure. If the issue is due to a violation of Kyverno policies, which are Kubernetes cluster policies for validating, mutating, and generating configurations, the section recommends fixing the pod configuration based on the best practices mentioned in the pod events after describing them.
use_cases: Troubleshooting pods in a 'Not Ready' state
Updating pod configurations based on best practices

name: High Number of pods in Not Ready state.txt - Impact
description: This section explains the potential impact of not adhering to infrastructure and security best practices when configuring pods. If the configuration is not done correctly, it may prevent new pods from being created or 'spun up' successfully. This could lead to issues with application availability or functionality.
use_cases: Ensuring proper pod configuration for application availability
Adhering to security best practices for pod deployment
Troubleshooting issues with pod creation or startup
